[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2890436][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/trends-mimikyu.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]MrBeast And His Crew Spend 24 Hours in Slab City[/color][/b]
Famous YouTuber MrBeast and his crew decided to spend 24 hours in the city with no laws known as Slab City. Slab City is located in the California desert east of the Salton Sea. It is about one hour and thirteen minutes away from where they do the Coachella fest every year. Just before you reach Slab City, you will come across this landmark known as Salvation Mountain, which is a hillside visionary environment created by Leonard Knight, who was a local from slab city who passed away in 2014. The crew decided to set up camp somewhere in the city. They've been greeted by some of the locals, most of which seem like very nice folk, all but one guy who started to tear up their basketball goal and started talking smack to them. Later on that night they head to a local party where they hosted an open mic night, and one of the dudes decided to sign up for the open mic to do some stand up comedy. MrBeast and the crew seemed to of enjoyed their stay in Slab City, everyone there just happened to have a really chill vibe. By the end of the video, one of the guys ended up getting sick and needed to go to the doctor to get checked out.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H1WBdh56Vq4] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Detective Pikachu "Full Picture"[/color][/b]
Someone on YouTube by the name "Inspector Pikachu" has uploaded a video that seems like the full movie for Detective Pikachu, but all you get instead is a Pikachu dancing for almost 2 hours. I actually think it's kinda cute, from the looks of it the video has been uploaded to hype up the upcoming film for Detective Pikachu which is said to be released May 10, 2019. Watching this video just hyped me up, even more, go see the real deal.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tAA_yWX8ycQ] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Godzilla: King of the Monsters - Final Trailer[/color][/b]
The final trailer for the upcoming new Godzilla movie is out. As a child, Godzilla was one of my most favorite movies and monsters of all time. The 1998 Godzilla movie, in my opinion, was a great movie; I only hope that this new movie is as good, if not better than the old movie. I also remember playing the Godzilla video games where you play as different monsters and fight each other in different maps, some of which you are fighting in a city. This new movie looks like the ultimate Monster VS Monster movie, and you have a lot of classic Godzilla monsters popping up in this one such as Mothra and Ghidorah. It looks like one epic monster battle is going to go down in this new Godzilla film. Godzilla: The King of Monsters is said to be released on May 31, 2019.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QFxN2oDKk0E]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3601559][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/animenews-nightmare.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Takeshi Obata Draws New Death Note 1-Shot Manga[/color][/b]
Tsugumi Ohba and Takeshi Obata's Death Note manga is getting a new one-shot manga chapter by Obata. The story will be related to what Shinigami bring about when they descend into to the earth. A part of the complete manuscript will debut at the "30th Work Anniversary Takeshi Obata Exhibition: Never Complete) event of which will run at 3331 Arts Chiyoda in Tokyo from July 13th to August 12th. Obata's completely original work that shares the "Nver Complete" title with the exhibition will also debut at the event. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2019-05-01/takeshi-obata-draws-new-death-note-1-shot-manga/.146310]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Ryo Ikuemi Launches New Manga This Fall[/color][/b]
Ryo Ikuemi will launch a brand new manga in the Cocohana magazine this fall. Ikuemi's Pops manga inspired a live-action film adaption in 2013, and her Anata no Koto wa Sorehodo manga inspired a live-action TV series in 2017. Ikuemi's Principal manga recently inspired a live-action film that opened in Japan last march. Ikuemi recently ended her Taiyo ga Miteiru (Kamoshirenai Kara) manga this past may.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2019-04-29/ryo-ikuemi-launches-new-manga-this-fall/.146256]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Haikyu!! Gets New Spinoff Manga on Shonen Jump+ App[/color][/b]
Shueisha's Shonen Jump+ website and app is currently listing that it will launch a spinoff of Haruichi Furudate's Haikyu!! manga series on May 13th. The manga is titled Haikyubu!! and is being drawn by Kyohei Miyajima. The manga is stated to be a "high-tension club activities comedy series that focuses on rival schools". Haikyu!! was originally launched by Furudate in 2011 in Weekly Shonen Jump. The manga is being published digitally and in print by Viz Media.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2019-04-28/haikyu-gets-new-spinoff-manga-on-shonen-jump-app/.146228]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
